qas.question: What is the most amount of ministers that a Prime Minister can assign?
What is another name for the governing body of ministers?
What strategy does the cabinet execute?
What major responsibility does the cabinet hold?

answers.text: everything occurring within the authority of executive power

context: The Prime Minister has the right to appoint a maximum of <a0_0>three<a0_0/> such ministers, as the limit of ministers in one government is fifteen. It is also known as <a1_0>the cabinet<a1_0/>. The cabinet carries out the country's <a2_0>domestic and foreign policy<a2_0/>, shaped by parliament; it directs and co-ordinates the work of government institutions and bears full responsibility for <a3_0>everything occurring within the authority of executive power<a3_0/>. The government, headed by the Prime Minister, thus represents the political leadership of the country and makes decisions in the name of the whole executive power.
